intro: Conandrium rhynchocarpum, commonly known as the horned burr. It is a species of flowering plant in the family Leguminosae, characterized by its distinctive, spiny fruit pods. The plant is native to parts of South America and thrives in dry, open habitats. Its leaves are trifoliate, and it produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The fruit, which resembles a horned burr, disperses its seeds through wind and animal contact.
